intro: Borreria densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered borreria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with woody stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Borreria densiflora is often found in dry, open habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
